content: criss-crosshatch cowl this is a simple stranded colorwork cowl worked in 2 colors choose contrasting colors in worsted weight yarn for this project the cowl is worked from the bottom up i recommend blocking the project once it is completed instructions provided below materials yarn 150-200 yards each of a light color main color = mc and a darker color contrasting color = cc i recommend malabrigo rios 100grams = 210 yards or tanis fiber arts purewash worsted 113 grams = 205 yards needles 24 size 3 5mm us size 4 circular needles 24 size 4 0mm us size 6 circular needles gauge not crucial but aim for a tight feeling knit notions 1 stitch marker blocking mat water misting bottle 16-20 blocking pins instructions with mc and larger needles cast on 144 stitches or any multiple of 8 stitches using your preferred stretchy cast on i used the german twisted cast on join in the round being careful not to twist the work and placing a stitch-marker where the round joins bottom ribbed band work 10 row of 2x2 ribbing repeat k2 p2 all the way around work the charted row repeating the 8 charted stitches all the way around work the desired number of row ending after either row 4 or row 8 ideal number is 48-60 row switching to smaller needles and working with cc work 10 row of 2x2 ribbing repeating k2 p2 all the way around bind-off in pattern i e k2 p2 using the simple knitted cast off if your bind-off is typically tighter than your knitting try using the suspended bind off marianne mckinnon copyright february 2018 page 1 criss-crosshatch cowl finishing i recommend blocking lightly as this will even out the ridge between the colorwork and the ribbed bands and it will even out the color contrasts throughout using a spray bottle spray your project with clean water rather than soaking it lie it flat ensuring that that your round-change line runs down the middle of one side pin the work by placing blocking pins along the ridge where the colorwork meets the ribbed band let it dry completely you will notice that the cowl lies flatter but also that it will feel less stiff chart 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 marianne mckinnon copyright february 2018 page 2
